pages.text: Food doesn't last forever, here. Without taking action, most foods will spoil in about a day, so it's highly recommended that you prepare them to last.$(br2)There are two ways you can prepare your foods to last:

If you salt your food, you can slow its rotting. You do this by crafting the food and salt together.$(br2)It is highly recommended to salt your food immediately! If it begins to spoil, $(d)the salt may have no effect$().
We aren't sure why, but food will spoil more slowly when it's in a $(#00a8a8)Picnic Basket$(). This could be a good option early on.
The power of The End can keep food fresh indefinitely! Place it inside a $(#00a8a8)Shulker Box$() or $(#00a8a8)Ender Chest$() to prevent spoilage altogether.
However, even if your food goes bad, that doesn't necessarily mean it's not useful anymore! On the following pages, you can read about what item results you can get.
Most unprepared foods will spoil into Rotten Flesh. Raw foods spoil faster than cooked foods, so it's a good idea to cook things up if you don't have access to salt.

Most fruits and vegetables will rot into this. It can be composted, or if you leave the $(#00a8a8)Rotted Residue$() to spoil even longer, it will eventually get eaten by $(#00a8a8)Earthworms$(), which you can use as Fishing Bait.

Most cooked meats will rot into this. It can be composted, or if you leave the $(#00a8a8)Rotted Residue$() to spoil even longer, it will eventually get eaten by $(#00a8a8)Grubs$(), which you can use as Fishing Bait.
Dead fish will spoil into $(#00a8a8)Fish Bones$(), which can be crafted into $(#00a8a8)Bonemeal$().
Many foods will spoil into $(#00a8a8)Wet Goop$(), which can be composted.
If you allow a $(#00a8a8)Potato$() to grow roots, it will then be plantable, so you can grow more $(#00a8a8)Potatoes$().
